affiliations.name: NSF National Center for Atmospheric Research

children.value: The following page is rendered from
A curated (and slightly opinionated) list of awesome ICESat-2 software, libraries, services, portals, and learning resources.

.
Initial listing generated by GPT5 during ICESat-2 Hackweek 2025.
- Official product documentation, user guides, and ancillary references for all ATL datasets.
- Search for, and download or stream NASA Earth science data with just a few lines of code.
- Unified interface for discovery, access, subsetting, and basic analysis of ICESat-2 (ATL*) products via NASA APIs.
- NASA web interface to discover, subset, and order ICESat-2 granules with custom spatial/temporal filters.
- REST search endpoint for programmatic discovery of ICESat-2 granules and collections.
- NASA cloud orchestration API for standardized reformatting, reprojection, and subsetting (emerging ICESat-2 support).
- Server-side, scalable ICESat-2 photon subsetting, filtering, and custom processing.
- A library of code for basic interactions with point data (including ICESat-2 tools)
- A library of code for advecting ice features using velocity data for analyses in a Lagrangian frame of reference
- A framework for fitting smooth surfaces to a variety of types of altimetry data.
- A do-it-all library of code for working with cryospheric altimetry data.
- A collection of software for analysis of ICESat-2 land and vegetation data.
- A project to map rifts in ice shelves around Antarctica.
- Tools for Estimating Grounding Zone Locations with data from NASA Polar Altimetry Missions.
- Web platform for interactive browsing, filtering, and quicklooks of ICESat-2 and ICESat elevation tracks.
- Notebook examples for dynamic photon queries and quick visual diagnostic plots.
- Compilation of tutorials developed from 2019 to present as part of the NASA / UW eScience hackweek program.
- Reusable Jupyter/Cloud workflow examples from community hackweeks.
- JupyterBook websites for ICESat-2 Hackweeks hosted at University of Washington 2019-2025.
- Official step-by-step Python notebooks for opening, filtering, and plotting ATL datasets.
- Usage guides for track selection, filtering, and downloading subsets.
- JupyterBook for cloud computing including tutorials working with ICESat-2 data.
- Code to generate the ATL11 (Slope-Corrected Land Ice Height Time Series) product based on the ATL06 (Land-ice height) product.
- Code to generate the gridded ice-sheet DEM and height-change products from ATL11.
- Raw telemetry with photon time-of-flight and instrument engineering for advanced calibration research.
- Atmospheric layer & cloud flag data supporting photon filtering and canopy penetration assessment.
- Predecessor laser altimetry mission enabling multi-epoch elevation change assessment.
- Spaceborne waveform lidar complementing ICESat-2 canopy height sampling for biomass analyses.
- Radar altimetry mission offering complementary sea ice thickness and ice sheet elevation trends.
- Active microwave backscatter supporting surface type classification and change detection alongside elevation trends.
- Multispectral imagery for land cover context and seasonal melt pond / vegetation mapping.
- Daily snow/ice products enabling temporal context for elevation/freeboard retrievals.
- Polar DEM mosaics used for reference elevation and geolocation QA.
- Historical laser altimetry providing multi-decadal context for elevation change.
- Complementary mass balance signals to compare with ICESat-2 elevation change in ice sheets.
- Atmospheric state variables for correcting backscatter or interpreting surface processes.
- Helpdesk for data access, documentation, and product interpretation questions.
- Official Q&A forum covering API access, subsetting, and dataset usage topics.

Contributions welcome! Please open an issue or pull request adding a resource with: (1) Name, (2) URL, (3) one-sentence description, (4) (sub)category suggestion. Keep descriptions concise, neutral, and avoid promotional language. Duplicates or out-of-scope links (non-ICESat-2 focused) may be declined to maintain curation quality.
